creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: waterway with buildings at left and right; six boats; tree at right; family in boat in foreground
inscription: left: 昭和十四年　晝の東京　飯田橋 {Shōwa jūyonen saku, [?????], Iidabashi} | bottom, printed: {Iidabashi} | in pencil: Toshi Yoshida
markings: LLC, red artist\'s seal: 吉田{Yoshida}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Tokyo at Noon (晝の東京)
title: Iidabashi
